description.narrative: The Vanuatu Forest Policy supports the establishment of a plantation estate with maximum involvement of smallholders. Already the development of a value-added industry based on whitewood plantations has begun, and the farm gate value of whitewood on Santo alone could reach $5 million per annum, based on 5,000 ha planted growing 20 m3 per ha per year. However there are still many challenges to overcome. This project has the following aims: to increase scientific knowledge for a range of locally appropriate agroforestry and plantation management systems that will maximise returns to smallholder landowners; to maximise value to growers through product development utilising lower value wood; and to enhance landowner knowledge and participation in the production of wood products for local and export markets.
